com.bfg.customer
Class Customer

com.bfg.customer.Customer
public class Customer

Holds the information about the currently logged in customer.

Copyright 2002, James M. Turner No warranty is made as to the fitness of this code for any particular purpose. It is included for demonstration purposes only.

Author:
James M. Turner

getCustomerId

public int getCustomerId()
Returns the unique customer ID, which is an autoincrementing database column used to uniquely identify each customer record.
Returns:
the customer ID

setCustomerId

public void setCustomerId(int id)
Sets the unique customer ID, which is an autoincrementing database column used to uniquely identify each customer record. Note that in normal usage, this should not be used because IDs are assigned by the database.
Parameters:
id - the customer ID

getWallet

public java.util.HashMap getWallet()
Returns a HashMap containing all the credit cards in the customer's wallet, with the key being the card id number.
Returns:
A HashMap containing CreditCard objects

getFieldError

public java.lang.String getFieldError(java.lang.String fieldname)
Returns a validation error against a specific field. If a field was found to have an error during validateCustomer, the error message can be accessed via this method.
Parameters:
fieldname - The bean property name of the field
Returns:
The error message for the field or null if none is present.

error - The error message for the field or null if none is present.

validateCustomer

public boolean validateCustomer()
Validates the customer for missing or invalid fields.
Returns:
true if the card passes the validation checks, otherwise false

sendPasswordReminder

public void sendPasswordReminder()
                          throws javax.naming.NamingException,
                                 javax.mail.internet.AddressException,
                                 com.bfg.customer.MessagingException
Mails a password reminder to the currently registered e-mail address for a customer.

findCustomer

public static Customer findCustomer(java.lang.String emailAddress)
                             throws CustomerActivityException
Given an email address, returns a new customer object populated from the database, or null if no such email exists.
Parameters:
emailAddress - The email address of the customer in the database
Returns:
A populated Customer object, or null if none found.
Throws:
CustomeryActivityException - Thrown on database errors

createCustomer

public void createCustomer()
                    throws CustomerActivityException,
                           DuplicateEmailAddressException
Creates a new customer in the database and sets the customer ID of the object to the newly created record's ID
Throws:
CustomerActivityException - Thrown if there is an error inserting the record in the database.

updateCustomer

public void updateCustomer()
                    throws CustomerActivityException
Updates an customer in the database.
Throws:
CustomerActivityException - Thrown if there is an error updating the record in the database.

addAddress

public void addAddress(Address addr)
                throws CustomerActivityException
Adds an address to the customer's address book in the database.
Parameters:
addr - An address which has already been created.
Throws:
CustomerActivityException - Thrown if there is an error updating the record in the database.

                   throws CustomerActivityException
Delete an address from the customer's address book in the database.
Parameters:
addr - An address to be deleted
Throws:
CustomerActivityException - Thrown if there is an error updating the record in the database.

deleteCustomer

public void deleteCustomer()
                    throws CustomerActivityException
Delete an customer from the database.
Throws:
CustomerActivityException - Thrown if there is an error deleting the record in the database.

valueUnbound

public void valueUnbound(com.bfg.customer.HttpSessionBindingEvent event)
Required method for HttpSessionBindingListener. Causes the content of the shopping cart to be saved when the customer's session times out.
Parameters:
event - The event

fillCart

public void fillCart()
Used to fill a cart from the database, which has been previously saved by a timeout.
